articles.headline: Streetwise Father Takes On Sloan Kettering to Save His Sick Son
articles.snippet: A father is battling Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center over the rights to developing a gene therapy that he hopes could cure his son’s blood disease.
articles.abstract: A father is battling Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center over the rights to developing a gene therapy that he hopes could cure his son’s blood disease.
articles.lead_paragraph: From his days as a troubled teenager on the gritty South Side of Chicago, Patrick Girondi has never shirked a fight.

articles.headline: Tesla Adds High-Speed Autonomous Driving to Its Bag of Tricks
articles.snippet: After a $2,500 software download, Model S drivers can let the car take over on the Interstate, the first car sold to consumers with such capabilities.
articles.abstract: After a $2,500 software download, Model S drivers can let the car take over on the Interstate, the first car sold to consumers with such capabilities.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It is not every day you get to open a door and step into the future.

articles.headline: For Pickens, Wind Claim May Be Last Power Play
articles.snippet: T. Boone Pickens, the 87-year-old oil and gas tycoon, is embroiled in a battle over wind power in the Canadian province of Ontario.
articles.abstract: T. Boone Pickens, the 87-year-old oil and gas tycoon, is embroiled in a battle over wind power in the Canadian province of Ontario.
articles.lead_paragraph: T. Boone Pickens made billions drilling for oil and gas and squaring off in bare-knuckled corporate takeover bouts.

articles.headline: Even the Issues Are in Debate in 2016 Race
articles.snippet: One of most striking takeaways from the Republican and Democratic debates is that the two parties do not just disagree on solutions to domestic and foreign policy issues — they do not even agree on what the issues are.
articles.abstract: One of most striking takeaways from the Republican and Democratic debates is that the two parties do not just disagree on solutions to domestic and foreign policy issues — they do not even agree on what the issues are.
articles.lead_paragraph: In one portrait of the nation put forward at the recent Republican presidential debates, America’s moral core is rotting, its citizens tolerating rampant abortions and even the dissection of fetuses for profit.

articles.headline: Norway Is a Model for Encouraging Electric Car Sales
articles.snippet: Skeptics, however, wonder whether the country’s program of government subsidies is cost-effective, or even an efficient way to reduce air pollutants.
articles.abstract: Skeptics, however, wonder whether the country’s program of government subsidies is cost-effective, or even an efficient way to reduce air pollutants.
articles.lead_paragraph: OSLO — Berit Nordgarden and her husband, Eivind Tellefsen, loved their nonpolluting Nissan Leaf electric car. But they found its 85-mile battery life too short for weekend trips to their cottage with their two young children.

articles.headline: Nigeria President Escalates Campaign to Stem Corruption
articles.snippet: Since assuming power in May, President Muhammadu Buhari has squeezed the flow of public funds in an effort to clean up Africa’s biggest economy.
articles.abstract: Since assuming power in May, President Muhammadu Buhari has squeezed the flow of public funds in an effort to clean up Africa’s biggest economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: ABUJA, Nigeria — Private jets that used to crowd the airport here have been grounded, their wings clipped by the new government’s crackdown on corruption. Rolls-Royces, Range Rovers and Jaguars are gathering dust in the showroom of this capital’s top car dealer. Luxury villas are left unsold, as is the fine Italian marble used to bedeck the homes of Nigeria’s newly rich.

articles.headline: What Could Raising Taxes on the 1% Do? Surprising Amounts
articles.snippet: A tax-the-rich plan could raise enough to, for example, eliminate all public undergraduate tuition while still allowing wealthy individuals to take home a majority of their income, economists argue.
articles.abstract: A tax-the-rich plan could raise enough to, for example, eliminate all public undergraduate tuition while still allowing wealthy individuals to take home a majority of their income, economists argue.
articles.lead_paragraph: When it comes to paying taxes, most Americans think the wealthy do not pay their fair share.

articles.headline: Greece’s Big Challenge: Fix Bad Loans Without Destroying Banks
articles.snippet: Providing responsible relief to the tens of thousands of Greeks unable to make loan payments is a top subject of discussion between Greece and its creditors.
articles.abstract: Providing responsible relief to the tens of thousands of Greeks unable to make loan payments is a top subject of discussion between Greece and its creditors.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATHENS — Apostolis Paliouras was proud of the bookstore he ran on the ground floor of an apartment building in a middle-class neighborhood here. Greek authors came to give readings and sign their works. People gathered to debate matters literary and political.
